lines.text: Mr Chadwick! Mr Chadwick!

[emerging from his hiding place]
Oh! It's you. I wasn't sure
Hiding in the closet isn't going to cure you. There's only one thing that will - you're going out tonight
Out there? They'll get me!
Dorothy, if a man ever asks you to romance his daughter, promise me you'll turn him down.
You have my word.
Did you see that, Calvin? Kissing, at nine in the morning, and practically inviting him to her bedroom. You won't find women like that in Cedar Rapids...
...No matter how hard you try
Mr Chadwick, many years ago in my youth, wanting to taste all of life's pleasures, I did a very foolhardy thing... I bit into a marriage licence
A lot of good men have choked on that

[having coffee poured into his cup]
Thank you. She was an American. Oh, it was an ideal marriage - until we left the wedding chapel
That's as much happiness as any man has the right to expect
It was raining. Her gown got wet. And somehow she made me feel that I had failed in my first act as a husband; I had permitted the rain to fall
She lost confidence. If you couldn't stop the rain, what would you do if an earthquake came?

I continued to fail her when she needed me most. Where was I when the pilot light went out on the stove? When her car ran out of gas? And what was I doing at the office, the day the plumbing got clogged?
An American husband would never be at the office when the plumbing got clogged - he'd rush home to share it with his wife
Then, one evening, we were sitting there enjoying a delightful dinner, when suddenly, my wife spoiled everything...
...She showed up
How did you know I was with another woman?
You said you were enjoying dinner, didn't you?
Oh, it was a harmless flirtation. I tried to explain to my wife. But all she could do was stand there - and say, 'Well'! It would not have helped to have dropped a thousand apologies into that well
A wife's well is bottomless
Now with a French wife, when I got home I would have found her in tears - and a new negligee. But with my wife, when I knocked on the bedroom door...
...you found her with her lawyer...
...and a travel agent
The next morning, she and the child were on a plane back to America. Fini!
Monsieur, a father with a daughter who is a thirty year old spinster... do you know what it means?
Yeah, it means that any able-bodied man who can run, walk or crawl should avoid you

Of course, when a daughter posseses a certain innocence at eighteen, for a father it's a joy to behold. When she's twenty-one, you're still happy but, er, thoughtful. When she's twenty-five, you are no longer smiling...
...It's getting grim
When she's twenty-nine, going on thirty, what does a father do?
Turns to prayer. There's nothing left

There is one hope - a man. A very special man; worldly, sophisticated. One who will gently lead her into a romantic adventure, an emotional interlude from whose fires a woman shall be born. Such a man is hard to find...
I will be, if you give me a ten minute head start!
Please, Monsieur, I'm desperate. Can a man abandon his only child?
I think, in this case, society will forgive you
What does she look like now? Today? This minute?
How does one describe inner beauty?
Forget the inside. Let's stay on the outside for a while
I feel safe in saying, she's attractive
You feel safe? Would it be risky for anyone else to say it?
I'm trying to be objective. You don't like heavy women?
No
You like them slim...?
How slim?
She's not the type of woman with the large hips and the over-developed bosoms that is so distasteful to men
What men?
An animated face, expressive eyes, a dazzling smile, exceptional teeth - outstanding
Big
A matter of semantics
She's a skinny, flat-chested girl with buckteeth. And so far you've only been talking about her good points
